name: Card Game Prototype
description:
It is a small card game prototype I put together in about 10 hours of work.

There's nothing much to it, it's principally to test mechanics.

You play by assembling magenta, yellow and cyan cards to deal damages to an opponent, and if you make a full set of three cards, you can apply an effect to someone. There are only three test cards and duplicates in this prototype.

On the bottom part you have your hand. You can see your cards better by dragging them on top of the "stats" part of the screen. On the left side of the screen (in lighter gray), you can drag cards to make a set and attack, costs will be shown on you stats.

Tell me what you think of the concept in the comments, if you encounter problems, signal them too. Remember that this is a prototype and everything can change. I'm actually going to rewrite it in C++, since Python was mainly used for putting a prototype together.
